c74object.name: dada.platform
c74object.description: Implements an scriptable and interactive interface for platform games

outlet.digest: bang when object is changed via the interface

method.name: (drag)
method.digest: Load file or set background image
method.description: Dragging an llll or text file on the object will load its content, if a proper readable format is recognized. If the file is an image, it will be loaded as object background (whenever meaningful)

method.name: (keyboard)
method.description:
• Esc: reset center to (0, 0) and zoom to 100%
• Tab: autozoom
• Cmd+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Z (win): perform undo step
• Cmd+Shift+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Y (win): perform redo step
• Cmd+S (mac) or Ctrl+S (win): fix state for undo and save
• Cmd+A (mac) or Ctrl+A (win): select all
• Backspace: delete selection
• Cmd+I (mac) or Ctrl+I (win): open inspector
• Spacebar: toggle play
• ↓, ↑, ←, →: move hero (respectively) down, up (= jump), left, right
• Tab: fire (shoot)
• Esc: set domain start at 0 (beginning of level)

method.name: (mouse)
method.description:
• Alt+click+drag: duplicate selected elements
• Cmd+click (mac) or Ctrl+click (win) on an element to delete it
• right-click or two-fingers tap on background: open contextual menu to add elements from prototypes

method.name: (tools)
method.description:
Tools are combination of a specific key pressed and some mouse action. Whenever you press the key, if the tool is available, the mouse cursor will switch to the tool specific one.
Available tools are:
• Keep the Z key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to change the zoom
• Keep the X key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to move the displayed center
• Keep the A key pressed, click on the background, and drag to create a selection rectangle.
↪ Add the Shift key to preserve previous selection

method.name: add
method.description: The add message, followed by an item type ("coin", "gamechar", "block" or "portal") and an llll, will add an item in the level, having specification set by the llll (see dump syntax).

method.name: addprototype
method.description: The addprototype message will add a new prototype to the current level (see dump syntax).

method.name: addsprite
method.description: The addsprite message will add a new sprite to the current level (see dump syntax).

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the sampling information regarding the sampling points set via the sample message.

method.name: break
method.description: The break message will stop any game actions to be performed after a given notification has been sent. Trigger the message synchronously with the notification in order to have it working (e.g. with no delays or deferring).

method.name: clear
method.description:
Examples:
• clear → delete all items
• clear coins → delete all coins
The clear message will delete every item. If followed by one of the symbols: "levelinfo", "sprites", "prototypes", "gamechars", "blocks", "portals", "coins", only the corresponding category will be deleted.

method.name: clock
method.description: The word clock, followed by the name of an existing setclock objects, sets the dada.bounce object to be controlled by that setclock object rather than by Max's internal millisecond clock. The word clock by itself sets the object back to using Max's regular millisecond clock.

method.name: count
method.description:
Examples:
• count coins → count all coins
• count coins where (pointsgiven 10) → only count coins giving 10 points
• count items where (name Juan) → count all items named "Juan"
• count gamechars where (vp 1) → count all gamechars with 1 VP
The count message, followed by one of the symbols: "gamechars", "blocks", "portals", "coins", "items", will return the number of corresponding items. If the "item" symbol is input, then the number of all items is returned. The symbol can be also followed by the "where" symbol and by a series of properties The answer is output preceded by the "count" router from the queries and notification outlet (second outlet).

method.name: delete
method.description: The delete message, followed by an item type ("coin", "gamechar", "block" or "portal") and an integer N, will delete the N-th item in the level.

method.name: domain
method.description: The domain message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the X axis. The domain message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the left boundary or at the right boundary of the object box.

method.name: dump
method.description:
Outputs the current state of the object. The syntax is platform (levelinfo LEVELINFO_SPECS) (sprites SPRITE1 SPRITE2...) (prototypes PROTOTYPE1 PROTOTYPE2...) (gamechars GAMECHAR1 GAMECHAR2...) (blocks BLOCK1 BLOCK2...) (coins COIN1 COIN2...) (portals PORTAL1 PORTAL2...)
Levelinfo specifiations have in the syntax: (title title) (hero hero_name) (bgsprite background_sprite_name) (gravity gravity_coefficient) (maxtime maximum_time_ms_or_none) (height level_height) (width total_level_width) (groundfriction ground_friction_coefficient) (airfriction air_friction_coefficient) (textcolor r g b a) (intro 0/1:has_intro_screen?).
Each SPRITE has the syntax: ((name name) (pics pic1_filename pic2_filename...) (rect x y width height) (stretch 0/1:can_stretch?) (slidetime slide_time_in_ms))
Each PROTOTYPE has the syntax: (prototype_name prototype_type (spec1 spec1_value) (spec2 spec2_value)...)
where prototype_type is one of the following symbols: "block", "coin", "gamechar", "portal" and each spec is a specification belonging to the corresponding category (see below).
Each GAMECHAR has the syntax: ((coord x y) (speed x y) (width w) (height h) (ext left right top bottom) (name name) (type gamechar_type) (points num_points) (vp num_vps) (direction 1/-1:right/left) (state state) (ability list_of_abilities) (howdies dying_ways) (howkills killing_ways) (idlesprite spritename) (walksprite spritename) (jumpsprite spritename) (glidesprite spritename) (flysprite spritename) (deadsprite spritename) (deathseq script_when_dying) (resurrectpositions (x1 y1) (x2 y2)...)), where gamechar_type can be "idle", "usercontrol", "enemy", "food" or "bullet".
where dying_ways and killing_ways represent the directions or movement allowing the element to die/kill, and are a list containing a combination of: "left", "right", "top", "bottom", "bump", "bullet", "glide". In turns, state is one of the following symbols: "idle", "walking", "jumping", "flying", "swimming", "running", "gliding", "dying", "dead", "generating", "enteringportal", "exitingportal", "elsewhere".
Each BLOCK has the syntax: ((coord x y) (width w) (height h) (name name) (sprite spritename) (solid 0/1:is_solid?) (howhit hit_ways) (hitseq script_when_hit) (loophitseq 0/1:is_hitseq_to_be_read_in_loop?) (breaksprite breaking_sprite_name) (state state) (pointsgiven num_points) (music music_llll_when_hit))
Each COIN has the syntax: ((coord x y) (width w) (height h) (name name) (sprite spritename) (takeable 0/1:is_takeable?) (taken 0/1:is_already_taken?) (pointsgiven num_points) (vpgiven num_vps) (music music_llll_when_taken))
Each PORTAL has the syntax: ((coord x y) (width w) (height h) (name name) (sprite spritename) (open 0/1:is_open?) (howenter entering_ways) (howexit exiting_ways) (enterseq script_when_entering) (exitseq script_when_exiting) (music music_llll_when_used) (heroonly 0/1:only_hero_can_use_it?)), where entering_ways and exiting_ways can be a list containing a combination of: "left", "right", "top", "bottom".
For all the scripting commands, refer to the script message, keeping in mind that you can use "hero" to refer to the hero and "me" to refer to the subject of the action (e.g. "give me 10 vp").

method.name: exportimage
fix
method.description: The fix message will "fix" the current state, making it available for undo (next undo action will revert to the last fixed state).

method.name: getdomain
method.description: The getdomain message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the X axis, preceded by a domain symbol.

method.name: getrange
method.description: The getrange message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the Y axis, preceded by a range symbol.

method.name: int
method.description: A non-zero integer triggers a play message, a zero integer triggers a stop message

method.name: play
method.description: Starts the sequencing enginge

method.name: range
method.description: The range message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the Y axis The range message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the bottom boundary or at top right boundary of the object box.

method.name: read
method.description: The specified file is read from disk and the llll it contains loaded as current state. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: resettime
method.description: The resettime message will set the current time to 0.

method.name: restart
method.description: The restart message will resume the level from the beginning; the optional integer argument sets the hero victory points.

method.name: resume
method.description: Resumes the sequencing enginge

method.name: script
method.description:
The script message will execute a sequence of actions, contained in the argument llll. Scripts can be also set inside some specification fields (e.g. "dieseq") and automatically triggered during playtime. Scripts must be a sequence of actions in the form (ACTION1) (ACTION2).... In all actions two keywords can be used: "me", referring to the subject of the action (if automatically triggered at playtime by fields such as "breakseq" or "dieseq"), and "hero", referring to the current gamechar hero. Actions can be the ones below (curly brackets refer to variables, while square brackets mean that the arguments are optional).
• give {gamechar (symbol)} {howmany (int)} [{what (symbol)} [from {item (symbol)}]]: gives a gamechar either points or victory points (vp). The gamechar must be called via its name, and the {what} symbol must be either "points" (default) or "vp". You can additionally specify from which character or element points are given.
• generate {gamecharprototype (symbol)} [from {item (symbol)}]: generates a gamechar from a given item (e.g. a block). If the item is not explicitly set, it is assumed to be the subject; otherwise it is assumed to be the item name. The character must be defined as prototype, and called via their its prototype name (and not its own name!).
• add {gamechar (symbol)} ability {whichability (symbol)} [during {milliseconds (double)}]: add an ability to a given character, represented by its name. If the "during" part is also assigned, the addition only last for a given amount of time.
• remove {gamechar (symbol)} ability {whichability (symbol)} [during {milliseconds (double)}]: remove an ability to a given character, represented by its name.
• change {item (symbol)} {attributes (llll)}: change some property of a given item (block, coin, game character or portal), according to an llll containing the new values for the attributes to be changed.
• notify {anything (llll)}: send a given notification from the notification outlet.
• goto [level {filename (symbol)} at] {portalname (symbol)} with {options (llll)}: go somewhere else, in the same level (defined by a portal name), or in a new level (defined by a symbol containing the filename, if in Max search path, or the file full path). Options can be given in llll form such as: ({option_name} {option_value}) ({option_name} {option_value})... Option names are: "intro" (whether or not the intro black screen should be shown; values are 0/1; if the option is not given, the level specification apply), "resettime" (whether or not the global time should be reset to zero; values are 0/1; 0 is the default).
• break {block (sym)} [by {gamechar (symbol)}]: break a block, identified by its name; if the "By" clause is also set, the "responsible" for breaking will be a given game character, also identified by its name. You can use the simple "break" word (without outer level of parentheses) for default breaking of blocks.
• wait {milliseconds (double)}: wait for some time before performing next action. • dontdie: when used in a dying sequence, prevents the character from dying.
• win: hero wins
• gameover: hero loses

method.name: set
method.description: The set message, followed by an item type ("coin", "gamechar", "block" or "portal") and an integer N and an llll, will modify the N-th item in the level, according to the specifications set via the llll (see dump syntax).

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops the sequencing enginge

method.name: write
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in native format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: writetxt
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in a human-readable text format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

attribute.name: airfriction
attribute.description: Sets the level air friction coefficient.

attribute.name: autoscroll
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to scroll automatically according to the hero position.

attribute.name: axescolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the x and y axes.

attribute.name: axeslabelscolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the x and y axes labels.

attribute.name: bgcolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the background.

attribute.name: bgimage
attribute.description: Sets a background image texture, tiling the plane. Use "" or "none" to remove the image.

attribute.name: bgsprite
attribute.description: Sets the level background sprite.

attribute.name: constraintzoom
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to constraint the zoom according to the level height.

attribute.name: continuousbang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang continuously during mousedrag actions.

attribute.name: editmode
attribute.description: Sets the edit mode: Lock (0) doesn't allow editing, "Not While Playing" (1) only allows editing while not playing, "Always" (2) also allows editing while playing

attribute.name: floattextfontsize
attribute.description: Sets the floating text font size.

attribute.name: gravity
attribute.description: Sets the level gravity coefficient.

attribute.name: groundfriction
attribute.description: Sets the level ground friction coefficient.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: Sets the level height.

attribute.name: hero
attribute.description: Sets the level hero name.

attribute.name: intro
attribute.description: Toggles the intro screen for the level.

attribute.name: jitmatrix
attribute.description: Sets the name of a jitter matrix to which the output should be mirrored.

attribute.name: legendfontsize
attribute.description: Sets the legend font size.

attribute.name: maxtime
attribute.description: Sets the level maximum time (use "none" to avoid setting it).

attribute.name: messagebang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang also when changes happen via messages.

attribute.name: notify
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send notifications for interface activities (such as clicks, mousehovers, etc.). Notifications are sent through the dedicated outlet. If the "Verbose" mode is set, whenever meaningful, the state of the notified element will be also output.

attribute.name: notifyblocks
attribute.description: Toggles the notifications for blocks.

attribute.name: notifycoins
attribute.description: Toggles the notifications for coins.

attribute.name: notifygamechar
attribute.description: Toggles the notifications for game characters.

attribute.name: notifygamecharpos
attribute.description: Toggles the notifications for game characters positioning.

attribute.name: notifypaint
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to notify every new redraw of the box via a "painted" symbol.

attribute.name: notifyportals
attribute.description: Toggles the notifications for portals.

attribute.name: notifyusercontrol
attribute.description: Toggles the notifications for user control actions.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the "t" specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: playmode
attribute.description: Sets the play mode: Can't Play (0) doesn't allow playing, Standard (1) allows play toggling via spacebar or messages, Can't Stop (2) doesn't allow stopping.

attribute.name: savefixed
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to only save states that had been "fixed" via fix message or via interface.

attribute.name: selectioncolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the selection.

attribute.name: showaxes
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the x and y axes.

attribute.name: showaxeslabels
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the x and y axes labels.

attribute.name: showblocks
attribute.description: Shows/hides all blocks.

attribute.name: showcoins
attribute.description: Shows/hides all coins.

attribute.name: showgamechars
attribute.description: Shows/hides all game characters.

attribute.name: showheroname
attribute.description: Shows/hides hero name in legend.

attribute.name: showleveltitle
attribute.description: Shows/hides level title in legend.

attribute.name: showpoints
attribute.description: Shows/hides points in legend.

attribute.name: showtime
attribute.description: Shows/hides remaining time in legend: Don't (0) doesn't show anything, Forward (1) shows increasing time, Countdown (2) shows countdown time.

attribute.name: showvp
attribute.description: Shows/hides victory points in legend.

attribute.name: textcolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the text for the level

attribute.name: textfont
attribute.description: Sets the level font.

attribute.name: title
attribute.description: Sets the level title.

attribute.name: undobang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang also when changes happen via messages.

attribute.name: vzoom
attribute.description: Sets the object vertical zoom percentage

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: Sets the level total width.

attribute.name: xlabel
attribute.description: Sets the label for the x axis.

attribute.name: ylabel
attribute.description: Sets the label for the y axis.

attribute.name: zoom
attribute.description: Sets the object zoom percentage (or horizontal zoom, if the object is separately zoommable on horizontal and on vertical axis).

entry.name: Outlet 4 (bang)
entry.description: bang when object is changed via the interface.
